ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about what I wanted to work in for my PhD, and it taught me the necessary techniques to do research in the field.
I learned a lot of knowledge in atomic physics which are really helpful with my research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is a very fast paced course, and requires consistent effort to be able to get through. However, at the end of the course, one emerges enlightened and ready with a lot of knowledge about the field.
Strength: lots of hands-on work with AMO theory. Weakness: not every topic covered in class is also covered in the problems, which makes me likely not to learn it as well.
I really like the organization of the class. I felt I learned a lot from doing problem sets.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but only if that student were prepared to put in the required effort.
Yes, if they are working in AMO.
If you want to do AMO related research, you should definitely take the class.
